guide.conclusion: Fun project to have kids help. Be sure to have an extra welding helmet.

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: I had too many bicycles in my yard, so I cut the number in half. It already has quite of few trips around the block. Determining the correct spacing between the front seat and rear handlebars is critical. Spacing between the rear handlebars and rear seat should be the same as on an original bicycle. Align the pedal crank bearing bores EXACTLY. I still haven't made a chain guard, but it hasn't been a problem yet.
guide.introduction_rendered:
I had too many bicycles in my yard, so I cut the number in half. It already has quite of few trips around the block. Determining the correct spacing between the front seat and rear handlebars is critical. Spacing between the rear handlebars and rear seat should be the same as on an original bicycle. Align the pedal crank bearing bores EXACTLY. I still haven't made a chain guard, but it hasn't been a problem yet.

Relevant parts
  • At least 2 standard bicycles
Tools
  • Standard bicycle tools
guide.summary: Bicycle built for two for little people.  I used parts and bicycles for 16 inch wheels.  By the time the kids can ride without training wheels they like to team up on this bicycle.
guide.time_required: About a day and a half
guide.title: Small Bicycle built for 2
